entry.title: All data from cds view not replicated to datasphere
entry.content:
Hi 

 

I have a cds view made of vbrp and vbrk and prcd_elements joined with the delta extraction annotations. The cds count is 5136 but when I do a replication via replication flow  to SAP Datasphere : it shows Initial Load Operations : 5136 but when I see in the data preview its only 3715 records. 

 

 

but in datasphere it only shows 1 record , for example the MAC shows only 0 and not the 80.22

 

 

Whats going wrong ? I have attached the cds code in the attachments.

entry.title: Packages for migrate between spaces
entry.content:
Hello,

We have a problem with packages in DataSphere.

We want migrate tables, views, etc between spaces.

We have created a package in one space which contain folders, view, tables etc and export works fine.

But when we try import the package, use overwrite preferences: don"t overwrite objects or data it doesn"t work because detect the same object in the space and not ignore the object: Error example " The object name(s) ["XX"] cannot be created because object(s) with same name(s) exist".

If we use the overwrite objects and data it doesn"t work too.

Could you help us please?

Thank you and regards,

entry.title: Datasphere - Install SAP Sample Data error
entry.content:
Hi community,

I would like to install SAP Sample Data in Datasphere, like "Finance Sample Data for SAP Data Warehouse Cloud" or "Sales Sample Data for SAP Data Warehouse Cloud". When I click on Error using this Link,  I get the message "You are currently not a member of any space and cannot install this data product. Please contact your system or space administrator." (see screenshot "No_Member).

But I have the Scoped_Data_Warehouse_Cloud_Space_Administrator Role for that Space (see screenshot "Space_Admin").

Why can't I install this sample data?

Kind regards,

Eric

entry.title: Optimizing SAP Datasphere Lifecycle Management with SAP Cloud ALM
entry.content:
In today's data-driven world, organizations rely on robust solutions like SAP Datasphere to connect, manage, and share trusted data across landscapes. However, to ensure successful implementation, seamless operation, and long-term scalability, governance and lifecycle management are critical. That‚Äôs where SAP Cloud ALM steps in.

SAP Cloud ALM provides a unified platform to manage the entire lifecycle of cloud-based solutions, including SAP Datasphere. By leveraging key capabilities such as Task Management, Change and Deployment Management, Health Monitoring, and Configuration & Security Analysis, businesses can streamline their data projects and enhance operational excellence.

1. Task Management: Aligning Teams and Priorities

Implementing or expanding SAP Datasphere often involves multiple stakeholders across business and IT. SAP Cloud ALM‚Äôs Task Management feature ensures that every activity‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs configuring data models, establishing pipelines, or integrating with source systems‚Äîis clearly defined, assigned, and tracked.

  • Project templates help structure efforts for quick onboarding.

  • Role-based task assignments ensure accountability.

  • Progress tracking gives real-time visibility into implementation and operations.

With these tools, teams stay aligned and avoid bottlenecks, keeping your Datasphere initiatives on schedule and on scope.

 

2. Change and Deployment Management: Controlled Innovation

SAP Datasphere evolves rapidly, and with it, so do your business requirements. SAP Cloud ALM enables controlled and transparent change processes through its Change and Deployment Management capabilities.

  • Safely manage configuration and transport changes.

  • Align changes across environments with dependency checks.

  • Maintain traceability from change request to deployment.

This ensures that updates to your data models, transformations, or integrations are introduced with minimal risk and maximum governance.

3. Health Monitoring: Real-Time Operational Insights

Once your SAP Datasphere environment is live, Health Monitoring in SAP Cloud ALM helps you maintain high availability and performance.

  • Dashboards provide real-time status of connected systems and components.

  • Alerts notify teams about anomalies or performance degradation.

  • Historical data helps in trend analysis and capacity planning.

This proactive monitoring approach reduces downtime, supports SLAs, and ensures your business users always have access to reliable data services.

4. Configuration & Security Analysis: Governance You Can Trust

Data security and compliance are non-negotiable, especially when dealing with sensitive or cross-border information. SAP Cloud ALM‚Äôs Configuration and Security Analysis tools empower your team to identify misconfigurations, enforce best practices, and close security gaps.

  • Analyze system settings for compliance with SAP recommendations.

  • Detect and remediate unauthorized changes.

  • Strengthen system hardening and data protection policies.

This is essential to meet internal governance policies and regulatory requirements, especially in data-centric platforms like SAP Datasphere.

More details HERE.

Conclusion

By integrating SAP Cloud ALM with SAP Datasphere, organizations gain more than just visibility, they gain control. From guiding implementation to ensuring secure and reliable operations, Cloud ALM acts as the backbone of sustainable data management in the cloud.

If you're looking to maximize the value of your data landscape, it's time to embrace SAP Cloud ALM, not just as a monitoring tool, but as a strategic enabler of trust, agility, and excellence in your Datasphere journey.

entry.title: How to use cds view annotation in the datasphere
entry.content:
Hello.

I made a cds view as follows and then replicated it in the datasphere.

@AbapCatalog.sqlViewName: 'ZBWTESTCDS02'
@EndUser‚ÄãText.label: 'Data Extraction for Actual Material Cost'
@AbapCatalog.preserveKey: true
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED

@Analytics: {
    dataCategory: #FACT,
    dataExtraction: {
        enabled: true,
        delta.changeDataCapture.automatic:true
    }
 }

define view ZBW_TEST_CDS02
as select from afpo a
inner join aufk b
   on a.aufnr = b.aufnr
  and a.mandt = b.mandt
inner join afko c
   on a.aufnr = c.aufnr
  and a.mandt = c.mandt
inner join aufm d
   on a.aufnr = d.aufnr
  and a.mandt = d.mandt
{
   key a.aufnr                                                as OrderID, 
   key b.werks                                                as Plant,
   key b.kokrs                                                as ControllingArea ,
   key d.matnr                                                as InputProduct,
   key d.budat                                                as PostingDate,
   d.mjahr                                                    as FiscalYear,
   b.auart                                                    as OrderType, 
   b.objnr                                                    as ObjectInternalID, 
   b.prctr                                                    as ProfitCenter ,
   a.matnr                                                    as Product,
   @Semantics.unitOfMeasure: true
   c.gmein                                                    as BaseUnit,
   d.meins                                                    as InputUnit,
   @Semantics.quantity.unitOfMeasure: 'BaseUnit'
   @DefaultAggregation: #SUM
   c.gamng                                                    as OrderPlannedTotalQty,
   @Semantics.quantity.unitOfMeasure: 'BaseUnit'
   @DefaultAggregation: #SUM
   c.igmng                                                    as OrderConfirmedYieldQty,
   cast(a.amein as productionunit preserving type)            as ProductionUnit,
   @Semantics.quantity.unitOfMeasure: 'ProductionUnit'
   @Aggregation.default: #SUM
   a.wemng                                                    as MfgOrderItemGoodsReceiptQty, 
   d.waers                                                    as TransactionCurrency,
   @Semantics.quantity.unitOfMeasure: 'InputUnit'
   sum(case when ( d.bwart = '261' or d.bwart = 'Z61' ) then d.menge when ( d.bwart = '262' or d.bwart = 'Z62' ) then -1 * d.menge else 0  end) as qty,
   @Semantics.amount.currencyCode : 'TransactionCurrency'
   sum(case when ( d.bwart = '261' or d.bwart = 'Z61' ) then d.dmbtr when ( d.bwart = '262' or d.bwart = 'Z62' ) then -1 * d.dmbtr else 0  end) as amt

}
-- skip -- 
where ~~ 
group by ~~


@Semantics.Annotation specified in cds view is not recognized in datasphere.
Only the business name is replicated as it is.

The local table is designated as a relational dataset,  and the semantic type is None.

Can't the annotation specified in csd view be used in the datasphere?
Is there a way to use the annotation specified in cds view in the datasphere?

I want the following results.

Thank you.

entry.title: Feature Engineering in SAP BTP: SAP HANA Cloud In-built ML vs. SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hello Team,

We are implementing a new predictive use case on SAP BTP. We've established our data ingestion strategy, where raw data from various enterprise sources (both SAP and non-SAP) is successfully ingested into SAP HANA Cloud via SAP Integration Suite.

Now, our primary focus is on the feature engineering phase for this data, which resides entirely within SAP HANA Cloud. We need to perform various transformations, including:

Calculating derived metrics (e.g., DaysSinceLastActivity, InteractionCount).

Aggregating historical data.

Leveraging capabilities for automated feature engineering.

Preparing the engineered features in a structured, consumable format for machine learning model training and inference.

Ensuring scalability, performance, governance, and reusability of these features.

We are specifically evaluating the best approach for this feature engineering. We see two primary paths within the SAP BTP landscape for data already in HANA Cloud:

Leveraging SAP HANA Cloud's In-built Machine Learning Capabilities: Utilizing its SQL/SQLScript, Predictive Analysis Library (PAL), Automated Predictive Library (APL), AutoML features, and Python Machine Learning Client directly within HANA Cloud.

Utilizing SAP Datasphere: Building and managing the feature engineering pipelines and feature store within Datasphere, which leverages HANA Cloud as its underlying engine.

Based on your experience with similar predictive projects on SAP BTP, we'd greatly appreciate your insights on the following:

For feature engineering on data already residing in SAP HANA Cloud, what are the key advantages and disadvantages of:

Relying primarily on SAP HANA Cloud's native ML and data manipulation capabilities?

Integrating SAP Datasphere into the architecture for feature engineering?

In which scenarios would you strongly recommend one approach over the other for a project like ours?

Are there specific types of feature engineering tasks (e.g., complex aggregations, specific derived metrics, automated feature generation) where one service truly excels when the data source is HANA Cloud?

Any architectural patterns, best practices, or practical experiences (including considerations for MLOps, governance, and long-term maintainability) would be highly valuable.

Thank you in advance for your contributions!

#SAPHANACloud, #SAPDatasphere, #MachineLearning, #FeatureEngineering

entry.title: how to integrate SAP Datasphere to SAP CPQ and extract data from Datasphere to SAP CPQ
entry.content:

Please provide some inputs on integration/connections and method/approach to send data from SAP Datasphere to SAP CPQ. Thanks!

--

KRPK

entry.title: MARD and MARC table delta with ABAP CDS Extractor (CDC Enabled) does not work
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

The tables MARC and MARD have a replacement objects in S4HANA. When a ABAP CDS view extractor (CDC enabled) is built on these tables , we have observed that the delta does not work if the record is changed but New records are coming as delta.

How do we handle delta for these tables ? Or do we have any alternate way to get the delta from table MARC and MARD in Datasphere.

Thanks,

Vinay

SAP Datasphere SAP Analytics Cloud

entry.title: DataSphere. Working with task chain
entry.content:
Hello, experts!

Questions in task chains:

1. If a chain is launched on schedule once every 5 minutes and runs longer, then the next launch crashes with an error, is this normal?

2. How to make the chain launch after the previous run. Returning to the previous question, so far I have done it through the second chain that calls the first... a kind of infinite loop.

3. And the third question, arising from the previous ones, can I interrupt the execution of the chain with some code (block) and place it in the chain at the end, for example.

4. Can I launch the second chain inside the chain in asynchronous mode?

This tool works here differently than in the classic BW....

entry.title: [Question] Unable to Use Remote Tables in SAP DataSphere ‚Äî Error 403 Forbidden via Cloud Connector
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I'm trying to connect from SAP DataSphere to an SAP ABAP On-Premise system using SAP Cloud Connector. The connection is partially successful, but Remote Tables are not working as expected.

  • Target: SAP ABAP System (On-Premise)

  • Connection Method: RFC via SAP Cloud Connector (ODBCforABAP adapter)

Connection status:

  • Data flows: Enabled

  • Replication flows: Enabled

  • Remote Tables: Not working

Error message:

 

In SAP Cloud Connector, under Monitor (Cloud to On-Premise), I can see multiple successful RFC calls:

How can I fix this?

Thanks in advance for your help!

Best regards,

entry.title: Approaches for reporting on Datasphere data through Iceberg table format in Azure datalake.
entry.content:
Hi üôÇ

I am looking for any input on how to report on SAP Datasphere data from an Azure Datalake using Iceberg format tables that can be consumed either through Databricks or Snowflake using either federated access or persisted. 

I know the path of doing an outbound replication flow writing Parquet files into the Azure Datalake and then have the datalake process the parquet files into Iceberg format. But is there other ways of setting up integrations between Azure Datalake Iceberg tables and Datasphere ?

I know this question might also be more of an Azure Datalake question but thought that someone might have had the same integration scenario.

Regards

Lars

entry.title: Transport Export is queued up
entry.content: Transport -> Export not started for long time. Status in the Transport monitor is 'Queued'. This was working fine before.

entry.title: Datasphere - HANA Cloud DB Remote Table (Insufficient privileges on HDI)
entry.content:
Hi experts,

We have created a connection in Datasphere to visualize the access to a HANA Cloud DB.

The set up is correct and we are able to import the relevant tables as remote tables but when we are trying to view the data we are getting the error as follows:

internal error: Error opening the cursor for the remote database <DWC_IL_BTP_HANA_APPS_EU.HANA_BTP_APPS_EU> [SAP AG][LIBODBCHDB SO][HDBODBC] General error;258 insufficient privilege: Detailed info for this error can be found with guid 'E3A628E32FA90D4B90B99370A3C9CBC4'

The issue is due to insufficient privileges of the user used in the Datasphere connection (DBAMIN) to access the HDI container where the table exist.

I understand that to solve the issue we need to assigned SELECT privilege to DBADMIN on the respective schema but, how can we do that?

Note that the HDI container has been created over an MTA so not sure how we can do to grant that permission.

Many thanks!

C.

entry.title: How to Migrate from Standalone SAP Analytics Cloud tenant to the SAC component in SAP Business Data
entry.content:
Are you moving from a standalone SAC tenant to the SAC component within SAP BDC? Here's what you need to know üëá

‚úÖ Option 1: Export & Import via SAC Content Network (Quick but Limited)

Yes, you can export and import SAC objects (stories, models, data actions) between tenants ‚Äî even from standalone SAC to SAC component of BDC ‚Äî using the Content Network.

But here‚Äôs the catch üëá üõë This method doesn‚Äôt unlock the full power of BDC ‚Äî you miss out on Access to BDC Data Products, Seamless Planning, and AI/ML integration via Databricks or AI Core.

‚úÖ Option 2: Recommended ‚Äì Rebuild with BDC in Mind

SAC ObjectMigration Strategy

üìä Stories & Dashboards :: Export/import via Content Network ‚Üí Repoint to BDC-backed models. Rebuild if needed.

üìà Planning / Analytic Models :: Recreate in Datasphere component of BDC‚Üí Connect to SAC for visualization

üîÅ Data Actions :: Rebuild manually in SAC component of BDC

üîå Connections :: Must be recreated in BDC

üîÑ Seamless Planning :: Set up SAC integration with Datasphere ‚Üí avoid data duplication

üß† Think of it as: Lift, Evaluate, Rebuild Smartly

You're not just copying. You're migrating to a better foundation and following are some of the advantages with option 2:

 

  • ‚úÖ BDC Data Products = reusable, governed assets
  • üîó Seamless Planning = real-time integration, no more data copies
  • ü§ñ AI/ML Capabilities = unlock smart forecasting, predictive planning
  • üß© Business Data Fabric = unified, scalable architecture

 

üìå Tip: Treat this as an opportunity to rethink your models, optimize performance, and align with SAP's future-ready data strategy.

#SAPBDC #SAPAnalyticsCloud #SAPDatasphere #SeamlessPlanning #SAPMigration #AIinSAP #BusinessDataCloud

entry.title: "Camel execution failed‚Äù Error on Fiori Registration (Only in Production) / Impact of Variable Table
entry.content:
Title:

‚ÄúCamel execution failed‚Äù Error on Fiori Registration (Only in Production) / Impact of Variable Table Reference?

Question:

‚ñ† Overview

In our Fiori application, an error occurs when clicking the Register button on a transactional entry screen.
The same code works fine in the test environment, but fails in the production environment.

‚ñ† Environment Setup (Simplified)

  • CDS view is used to read cost department master data (name anonymized)
  • Backend is Node.js, accessing CDS via CAP service
  • The CDS view references a table, passed via variable in the service

‚ñ† Environment Differences

The referenced table has a higher record count in production (e.g. test: 3,000 records, production: 3,500 records).
CDS view definitions and service logic are identical across environments.

‚ñ† Error Message (Excerpt)

 
[SqlError: internal error: Camel execution failed. Reason: Cannot process result] { code: 403, sqlState: 'HY000' }

We noticed the generated SQL contains something like JSON_TABLE('{}'), which may be contributing to the failure when handling empty JSON input under certain conditions.

‚ñ† Code Example (with variable table name)

Here is the original code using a variable for the table name:

 

 
const result = await this.tx.run(
    SELECT.one.from(table).where(conditions)
);

This code causes a 403 error only in the production environment.

‚ñ† Temporary Fix (working version)

When we explicitly provided the table name as a string, the issue was resolved:

const table = 'Z_ACTUAL_COST_DEPT_MASTER'; // ‚Üê anonymized actual table name const result = await this.tx.run( SELECT.one.from(table).where(conditions) );

‚ñ† Questions

  1. What could be the root cause of the Camel execution failed. Reason: Cannot process result error in this context?
  2. Could the use of JSON_TABLE('{}') in the CDS-generated SQL cause issues in production due to volume or empty JSON input?
  3. Is it possible that using SELECT.from(variable) in CDS behaves differently across environments (e.g. due to view resolution)?
  4. Are there any best practices for safely referencing tables via variables in CDS views, especially for production stability?

‚ñ† Notes

  • Table names and record counts are anonymized.

  • I can provide HANA version and CDS definitions if needed.

entry.title: How to refresh data automatically in SAP Analytics Cloud for Excel
entry.content:
Hello.

I am currently refreshing data manually in SAP Analytics Cloud for Excel.

Right now, my data goes up to July, but when August data becomes available, I want my Excel reports to automatically show data up to August‚Äîwithout having to refresh manually.

Is there a way to automatically refresh data at a specific time in the background?

Thank you
